text: GrokCity’s subway has four lines, two timelines, and one train refusing to stop since 1998.
The Celestial District has no crime — trouble is too polite to occur there.
The Pothole of Destiny leads to another dimension. Parking here grants prophecy.
A taco stand sells Truth Tacos every Tuesday. Side effects: clarity.
Neon gulls in Harbor Sector accept shiny offerings and deliver gossip.
The Library of Maybe lends books that return with alternate endings.
GrokCity’s mayor is a highly organized rock. Re-election pending.
The Clocktower chimes in languages trending on X.
Every midnight, lampposts share stories about the sunset.
The Market of Slightly Broken Things sells maps that forget themselves.
An alley returns whatever you whisper — except secrets.
GrokCity weather is negotiable if you tell a compelling joke.
The Glass Gardens bloom only when someone recalls a childhood promise.
A bench plaque reads: ‘Reserved for someone about to change a mind.’
The Signpost of Decisions points to ‘Maybe’ more often than ‘Here’.
